channel.title: How the heck do i open .java and .class files?
channel.description:
Im trying to make a p server and the tutorial says this:
[1] Go to my Client folder. Then scroll down until you see a folder called "EGUI.JAVA"
[2]Open it up. And look towards the bottom.
[3] You should see 3 things in a line that say. "0.0.0.0"
I found the folder and the file, the problem is i can't find any software that will open this .java file, and when i open it in notepad it doesnt show the information that it is suppose to. (The "0.0.0.0" bit). Any help will be appretiated.
EDIT: im using windows 7 if that helps.

item.title: How the heck do i open .java and .class files?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

note pad is more simple and easier to use

but wordpad is more orginized and imo its better for noobs cause with wordpad you can copy and paste codes of mopar and they will stay formated

with notepad it all kind of blends together and doesnt work too well

item.title: How the heck do i open .java and .class files?
item.dc:creator: @billyjr33 billyjr33
item.description:
@billyjr33 wrote:

When you open it like you showed us what it looks like anyway ill tell you where to put your ip address ok

import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“IP ADDRESS GOES HERE”, “IP ADDRESS GOES HERE”, “IP ADDRESS GOES HERE”
});
}
}

Hoped i helped if you haven’t found it out yet.

Read full topic

import java.awt.BorderLayout;

item.source: How the heck do i open .java and .class files?

item.title: How the heck do i open .java and .class files?
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

(I can see your new to this :P)

Right click the .java file and select “Open with…”
If its a menu instead of a button, click “Choose default program”
Look for Notepad on the list.
If you have Windows Vista or 7, you have to click this arrow thing in the middle of the window (if it points down) to see it.
.class files are compiled .java files, and cannot be opened.

Read full topic
